description: System-generated unique identifier for this report type record; used as the primary key in the reporting metadata.
Business-facing report code used by the application to reference the report template and menu entry.
Human-readable title or summary describing what the report shows for users.
Report template file name used by the reporting engine to render the output.
Boolean flag controlling whether the report appears in user menus and selections.
Flag indicating the report includes charting elements or supports graphical output.
Flag marking whether the report is user-defined versus delivered standard content; likely; confirm with SME.
Flag to include this report in the Work Order print options list.
Flag to include this report in the Purchase Order print options list.
Name of the database view or query used as the report’s data source/filter.
Indicates whether the report contains one or more subreports.
Detailed notes describing the report’s purpose, grouping, and usage considerations.
Maximum number of records the report will retrieve to manage performance and result size.
Serialized configuration for chart selections or graph parameters; likely used by the report engine—confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the most recent change to this report definition or related metadata.
Identifier of the user or process that created the report definition record.
Timestamp when the report definition record was created.
Identifier of the user who last updated the report definition record.
Timestamp when a user last modified the report definition record.
